to give the title compound

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 4-phenyl-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid-amide hydrochloride (0.5 g, 2.1 mmol), 1-(3,4,5-trimethoxybenzyl)-3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-3-(2-oxo-ethyl)-pyrrolidine (0.23 g, 0.53 mmol), and titanium(IV) isopropoxide (0.2 g, 0.7 mmol) in methanol (5 mL). Add a solution of sodium cyanoborohydride in tetrahydrofuran (0.9 mL, 1M, 0.9 mmol). After 18 hours, a precipitate had formed. Filter, rinse with methanol and dichloromethane, and evaporate the filtrate to give a residue. Combine residue with dichloromethane and an aqueous 2M solution of potassium hydroxide. Separate the layers, extract the aqueous layer with dichloromethane, combine the organic layers, dry over MgSO4, filter, and evaporate in vacuo to give a residue. Chromatograph the residue on silica gel eluting sequentially with ethyl acetate, dichloromethane/methanol/concentrated ammonia (196/4/0.2), dichloromethane/methanol/concentrated ammonia (242/8/0.4), and then dichloromethane/methanol/concentrated ammonia (238/12/0.6) to give the title compound. Elemental Analysis calculated for C34H43 Cl2N3O4.0.4 H2O: C 64.52; H 6.64; N 6.64. Found C 64.15; H 6.33; N 6.67.

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 2-[3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethanol (1.0 g, 38.5 mmol) and butanone. Add a solution of (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid (1.6 g, 38.0 mmol) in butanone (80 mL). Heat to reflux. After 15 minutes, cool to ambient temperature and then cool further in an salt-ice bath. Filter the solid that forms and rinse with butanone. Recrystallize the solid from water/methanol to give (S)-(-)-2-[3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethanol (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid salt: mp; 201°-204° C. (dec). [α]2D0 =-18.9° (c=0.60, dimethylsulfoxide). X-ray diffraction analysis of a single crystal confirms the (S)-configuration. Analysis on HPLC, on an analytical sample of the free amine obtained by extraction, using a CHIRALPAK AD 25 cm×0.46 cm column eluting with pentane/methanol/triethylamine (80/10/0.1) with a flow rate of 1.0 mL/minute indicates an enantiomeric excess of 96%, (96% ee), retention time of the (S)-isomer 11.2 minutes, retention time of the (R)-isomer 14.5 minutes.

dl:reactionAction.dl:phraseText: Add a solution of (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid (1.6 g, 38.0 mmol) in butanone (80 mL)

cool to ambient temperature
cool further in an salt-ice bath

rinse with butanone

to give (S)-(-)-2-[3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethanol (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid salt

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid (0.8 g, 19 mmol) and aqueous 12M hydrochloric acid solution (0.16 mL, 19 mmol) in water/methanol (10 mL)/(10 mL). Heat to reflux. Add dropwise, a solution of 2-[3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethanol (1.0 g, 38.5 mmol) in methanol (10 mL). After 15 minutes, slowly cool to ambient temperature. Filter the solid that forms and rinse with water to give (S)-2-[3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethanol (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid: mp; 201°-204° C. (dec). Analysis by HPLC, as described in Example 106.1.1 indicates an enantiomeric excess of 97%, (97% ee).

rinse with water
to give (S)-2-[3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethanol (R,R)-di-p-anisoyltartaric acid

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 3,4,5-trimethoxy-benzoic acid (3.5 kg, 16.5 mol) and 1,2-dimethoxyethane (14.2 kg) and dimethylformamide (4 g). Cool in an ice bath. Add oxalyl chloride (2.99 kg, 23.5 mmol) over about 50 minutes not allowing the temperature of the reaction to raise above about 19° C. After 20 hours, concentrate in vacuo at 25° C. to remove about 3.7 kg of distillate to give a solution of 3,4,5-trimethoxy-benzoyl chloride.

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 4-pyridylacetonitrile (19.4 g, 125 mmol), N-benzyl-N,N-bis-(2-chloroethyl)amine hydrochloride (33.6 g, 125 mmol), and hexadecyltributylphosphonium bromide (3 g, 6 mmol) and a 50% aqueous sodium hydroxide solution. Heat to 100° C. After 1 hour, cool the reaction mixture to ambient temperature and repeatedly extract with diethyl ether. Extract the combined organic layers twice with an aqueous 10% hydrochloric acid solution (350 mL). Combine the aqueous layers and neutralize with an aqueous 50% sodium hydroxide solution. Again extract three times with diethyl ether, combine the organic layers, dry over MgSO4, and filter. Add a solution of hydrochloric acid in dioxane (60 mL 4M, 240 mmol) and evaporate in vacuo to give 1-benzyl-4-cyano-4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine hydrochloride.

to give 1-benzyl-4-cyano-4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine hydrochloride

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 1-benzyl-4-cyano-4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine hydrochloride (1.6 g, 4.5 mmol), a concentrated aqueous sodium hydroxide solution (1.5 mL, 50%, 9 mmol) and ethanol (30 mL). Heat to about 55° C. Add an aqueous solution of hydrogen peroxide (3.0 mL, 30%, 26 mmol) over about 10 minutes. After 3 hours, add an aqueous solution of hydrogen peroxide (2.0 mL). After 1 hour, cool to ambient temperature and dilute with water (20 mL), concentrate in vacuo, add water (40 mL), and again concentrate in vacuo to give a solid. Collect the solid by filtration, rinse with water, and dry to give 1-benzyl-(4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid amide: Rf =0.20 (silica gel, 9/1 dichloromethane/methanol).

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Alternately, combine 1-benzyl-4-cyano-4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine hydrochloride (20.3 g, 58 mmol), a concentrated aqueous sodium hydroxide solution (20 mL, 50%) and ethanol (400 mL). Heat to about 50° C. Add an aqueous solution of hydrogen peroxide (40 mL, 30%) over about 10 minutes. After 18 hours, add an aqueous solution of hydrogen peroxide (10 mL). After 3 hour, cool to ambient temperature and dilute with water (200 mL), concentrate in vacuo to remove most to the ethanol (about 400 mL). Add water (200 mL) and extract twice with ethyl acetate. Extract the combined organic layers with water and then brine, dry over MgSO4, filter, and evaporate in vacuo to give a solid. Dissolve the residue in hot ethyl acetate (500 mL) by the addition of methanol. Filter and concentrate the filtrate in vacuo to give a solid. Triturate the solid with dichloromethane and collect by filtration, and dry to give 1-benzyl-(4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid amide: Rf =0.62 (silica gel, 7/3 dichloromethane/methanol).

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 1-benzyl-(4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid amide, (0.22 g, 0.67 mmol) and ethanol (20 mL). Add 5% palladium-on-carbon (0.14 g) and hydrogenate on a Parr apparatus at 55 psi. After 48 hours, remove the catalyst by filtration and evaporate the filtrate in vacuo to give a residue. Combine the residue and methanol. Add a solution of hydrochloric acid in dioxane (2 mL, 4M, 8 mmol) to give a solid. Collect the solid by filtration to give 4-(pyridin-4-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid amide hydrochloride.

Add dropwise, N,N-diisopropylethylamine (10.2 g, 58.6 mmol). Add dimethylformamide (150 mL) and dichloromethane (100 mL). Add dropwise, a solution of di-tert-butyl dicarbonate (11.6 g) in dimethylformamide (50 mL). After 18 hours, dilute the reaction mixture with ethyl acetate and extract with water. Extract the aqueous layer with ethyl acetate, combine the organic layers and extract with water and then brine. Dry the combined organic layers over MgSO4, filter, and concentrate in vacuo to give 1-tert-butoxycarbonyl-4-phenyl-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid.

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Combine 1-benzyl-(4-(pyridin-3-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid (2.5 g, 8.4 mmol) and morpholine (1.5 g, 16.9 mmol) in dimethylformamide (65 mL). Add 1-ethyl-3-(3-dimethylaminopropyl)carbodiimide hydrochloride (EDC) (2.2 g), 1-hydroxy-benzotriazole hydrate (HOBt) (1.6 g), and dimethylformamide (25 mL). After 24 hours, pour the reaction mixture into a saturated aqueous sodium bicarbonate solution and extract twice with diethyl ether. Combine the organic layers, dry over MgSO4, filter, and concentrate to about 50 mL to give solid. Collect the solid by filtration, rinse with diethyl ether, and dry to give 1-benzyl-(4-(pyridin-3-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid morpholine-amide: Rf =0.67 (silica gel, dichloromethane/methanol/concentrated ammonia 90/10/0.5).

dl:reactionAction.dl:phraseText: Prepare by the method of Preparation 16 using 1-benzyl-(4-(pyridin-3-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid and 4-methylpiperazine
to give

dl:source.dl:paragraphText: Prepare by the method of Example 88.6 using (S)-2-[1-(3,4,5-trimethoxy-benzoyl)-3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethyl-methanesulfonate and 4-(pyridin-3-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid 4-methylpiperazine-amide to give, after chromatography on silica gel eluting sequentially with ethyl acetate, 1% methanol/dichloromethane, 3% methanol/dichloromethane, 5% methanol/dichloromethane, 7% methanol/dichloromethane, and then 9% methanol/dichloromethane, the title compound: Rf =0.29 (silica gel, methanol/dichloromethane/concentrated ammonia 10/90/0.5).

dl:reactionAction.dl:phraseText: Prepare by the method of Example 88.6 using (S)-2-[1-(3,4,5-trimethoxy-benzoyl)-3-(3,4-dichloro-phenyl)-pyrrolidin-3-yl]-ethyl-methanesulfonate and 4-(pyridin-3-yl)-piperidine-4-carboxylic acid 4-methylpiperazine-amide
to give
